-- Create a table to store the alert messages
CREATE TABLE alerts (
    message VARCHAR2(100),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
-- Define the alert procedure
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE my_alert (message IN VARCHAR2) IS
    INSERT INTO alerts (message, timestamp) VALUES (message, SYSTIMESTAMP);
-- Register the alert procedure with the DBMS_ALERT package

-- Start the continuous query notification
EXEC DBMS_ALERT.WAIT

Q: What is the name of a python package or library that can be used to write a bash script to monitor system resource usage?
A: There is no specific python package or library designed for this purpose. However, you can use the built-in psutil library in Python to monitor system resource usage. Here's an example script that uses psutil to monitor CPU usage and memory usage:

 ```python
import psutil
import time

while True:
    # Get CPU usage
    cpu_usage = psutil.cpu_percent()
    print("CPU Usage:", cpu_usage, "%")

    # Get memory usage
    memory_usage = psutil.virtual_memory().percent
    print("Memory Usage:", memory_usage, "%")

    time.sleep(1)
```
This script will continuously print out the CPU and memory usage percentages every second. Note that this is just one way to use psutil to monitor system resource usage - there are many other functions available in the library that you can explore.

    # Generate a random string as input data
    input_data = "This is some input data"
